BR_text.BRdescription:
Environment:
 
 Framework: (TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, MXNet)
 Framework version:
 Horovod version:
 MPI version:
 CUDA version:
 NCCL version:
 Python version: 3.6
 OS and version: Ubuntu 18.04.4
 GCC version:
 
 Checklist:
 
 Did you search issues to find if somebody asked this question before?
 If your question is about hang, did you read this doc?
 If your question is about docker, did you read this doc?
 Did you check if you question is answered in the troubleshooting guide?
 
 Bug report:
 Please describe errorneous behavior you're observing and steps to reproduce it.
 Hello. I've followed the instructions in the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/horovod/horovod/blob/master/docs/docker.rst>docker guide</denchmark-link>
 .
 While building Horovod in docker by running
 <denchmark-code>$ docker build -t horovod:latest horovod-docker-gpu
 </denchmark-code>
 
 I've got the following error
 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33629617/76625760-4ae31400-657b-11ea-9e6e-8c28ef3ec12c.PNG></denchmark-link>
 
 As a workaround, I added an argument to get_supported() function like:
 <denchmark-code>w.get_supported('.')
 </denchmark-code>
 
 And it worked well.

comments_0.comment_text:
Thanks for catching this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/abcinje>@abcinje</denchmark-link>
 .  Looks like there was a breaking change to the  module at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pypa/wheel/commit/b5733b86155c696274564e86c2a5f966f9abbebf>pypa/wheel@b5733b8</denchmark-link>
 .  I'll make a fix.
